intro: Hydriastele selebica, commonly known as the Celebes hydriastele, is a species of flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It has a compact growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
